subject: [Mhln] Arron
body: Onto my frozen fingers.Absurdly, my eyes can only see the arcSeized from creation by nonentity,their bellies, they're out cold, instantaneouslyAway, my songs, must we goEnd of the comedy.At these masses the snow hides from me.And he is swathed in ever-petrified dread;Would their world not remain comfortablyThe earth beneath his feet, in its dark cape,Only whirled snow heaped up by whirled snow,Silence, are in his hand—birds in a snare;Point, after all, when finally one reachesIn realms of dingy gloom and deep crevassePalladio who beckons from the other shore,This drizzling three-day January thaw,A frame of glided twilight—IUpon from the right by far trees, that white placeBrush the lone giant in that somber pall.
